intro: Arenaria violacea, commonly known as the violet sandwort, is a low-growing perennial plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It typically features succulent, fleshy leaves that are often bluish-green in color, adapted to retain moisture in arid environments. The plant produces small, delicate flowers that range in color from purple to blue, often appearing in clusters at the ends of its stems. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Arenaria violacea is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to withstand harsh growing conditions.
